text:
<@U25PYL3Q8> the form is displaying the user subscriptions. Because there are so many, those subscriptions are grouped and thats why they are grouped into multiple checkboxes - which was not the best idea apparently.
When the user enters the form, the selection for this user is preloaded, and the user is free to change whatever. Now the non-standard behavior kicks in: HubSpot will only transfer additional selections to the CRM. Deselecting any of the preloaded options is not stored.
<@U01ASFZL4UA> <@U01QVR44MEY> yup thanks. I really hoped there is a clean solution out there :smile:

Gotcha. You are not using the normal manage subscription preferences link for the user   If you are going to use your own solution to manage subscriptions, I would advise using an HTML form and writing out all of the script and then submitting via the forms API
Hi guys ,does anybody have an idea of what is causing this problem only on laptop and medium screens
I'm getting like a border on the end of the module
But on big screens and small screens it disappears
I have lost a ton of time tryign to figure out what is causing this

Have you used "inspection tool" in the browser to locate it?
I'd do that first, and check the css on the border.
It's likely a css issue. Send me a preview link
Dnd element with margin or padding
<https://share.getcloudapp.com/DOurqmRr>
I see no issue
is this a cache issue?

br line

It's in the first second of your video a small gary horizontal line
gray*
up from full servie partners

Thank you very much
For the help
I am a junior developer and this bug was losing me days
always use the preview links as they wil lhelp out wiht cache issues in HubSpot
and alway with debugging — remove as much noise as possible. The less factors in place when you are checking something out, the easier it is to pinpoint issues
Thanks for the advice
Btw again it's out of my controll
what is happening here
<https://share.getcloudapp.com/o0uXeZev>

Not sure if this will help, but we have noticed HS has changed how the padding/margin is working with the desktop/mobile toggle.

For our theme, we set all Sections to 0 px for padding, but if you don't check Apply to all Sides, it is creating a tablet version that doesn't get updated and adds mystery padding to the sides in our case, maybe that's where it is coming from for you?
very interesting

It changed within the last couple of weeks, as we have video tutorials that show the prior results and now can't recreate the same results. We think (and hope) they are working on adding a table toggle...
Thank you to both of you for helping me a lot with this issue
And <@U25PYL3Q8> as you said that was the issue ,bad photo with black background it works
ah, that is awesome, easiest fix of all :slightly_smiling_face:

Live] Collaboration Sidebar in the CMS editors
  
What is it?

The Collaboration Sidebar, including Commenting, Tasks and Calendar is now available inside the CMS editors including Blog, Landing Pages and Website Pages.

Why does it matter?

As collaboration continues to shift more and more to online, customers often have questions or feedback while working on an asset in HubSpot. While customers have had access to a commenting feature in Marketing Hub and CMS Hub for a while, the feature hasn't been as deeply integrated into overall work flow for customers as much as we'd like. With this release, we're excited to bring the newest version of the embedded Collaboration Sidebar updates to the CMS editors, a place where collaboration is critical to ensuring you put your best foot forward on your website and blog.

How does it work?

Next time a customer enters the landing pages, website pages or blog post editors, they'll see the Collaboration Sidebar available across each screen of the editor. This includes three tools, Commenting, Marketing Tasks and Marketing Calendar:
<@UDHT6N5SM>
